title: Dungeons & Dragons Visual History Special-Edition Box Set Gets $80 Discount
description: D&D: Art & Arcana: A Visual History Special Edition Box Set $45.91 (was $125) See at Amazon D&D fans can save big on a really cool special-edition book box set at Amazon during the retailer's Big Spring Sale. Dungeons & Dragons Art & Arcana: A Visual History Special Edition is available for only $45.91 (was $125). To get the full $80 discount, you need to click the coupon box beneath the price on the store page to slash an additional $21.26 from the price. select the coupon box under the price listed on the book's Amazon store page. title: Popular PC & Switch Controller With Built-In Screen Gets Nice Discount
description: One of the most popular Nintendo Switch and PC controllers sold by Amazon is on sale for a great price. The ManbaOne Wireless Controller, which released in March 2024, is up for grabs for $56 (was $70) as part of the retailer's Big Spring Sale. This matches the lowest price yet for this pro-style controller with a built-in miniature display. Yes, the ManbaOne has a terrible name, but it's a pretty awesome controller that impressed us when we tested it last year. Both the white and black models are included in the promotion. ManbaOne Wireless Controller $56 (was $70) Works with Switch, PC, iOS, AndroidFour remappable back buttonsAvailable in white and blackHall Effect analog sticksCustomizable lightsSix-axis gyroscopeBuilt-in displayTrigger locksThe ManbaOne Wireless Controller packs in tons of features and is highly customizable. Its main attraction is a built-in two-inch display, which lets you quickly change settings without the need for an app or additional software. Beyond that standout feature, this is a feature-rich pro-style controller.That means youâ€™ll find four remappable back buttons, premium Hall Effect analog sticks to prevent drift, trigger locks for faster actuation, and a fully customizable RGB lightbar on its side. Toss in a turbo setting and six-axis gyro support, and youâ€™ve got a controller thatâ€™s incredibly well-equipped for less than $60. As a bonus, the ManbaOne comes with its own charging dock and a set of interchangeable thumbsticks.Both the white and black versions are discounted, and theyâ€™re both pretty stylish. The white model is a bit more mechanical, as it shows off various components underneath the faceplate, while the black model is closer to what youâ€™d expect a traditional controller to look like. See at Amazon Buy Black Though the ManbaOne is on sale for a solid price, itâ€™s not the only notable controller discounted in Amazon's Spring Sale. It's not even the only controller with a built-in display. The Turtle Beach Stealth Ultra for Xbox and PC has a built-in screen with similar features, though it's much pricier at $170 (was $200). The Asus ROG Raikiri Pro has an OLED screen, but it's largely used for customizable animations and displaying settings.More Gaming Controller Deals at AmazonIf you're looking for more budget-friendly wireless controllers, we've rounded up a selection of other notable third-party gamepads on sale at Amazon this week. Numerous 8BitDo controllers have received price cuts, including the new 8BitDo Ultimate 2 Wireless Controller for PC and mobile and the modular Victrix Pro BFG Wireless Controller for Xbox and PC. The latter is on sale for an all-time low price of only $108 (was $180).Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 872
description: Soâ€¦what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isnâ€™t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. Itâ€™s just a list of more or less random questions Iâ€™ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Which is the hardest to do: engage in small talk with strangers, ask for directions, paint your toe nails or cook a meal without a recipe? For the life of me, I canâ€™t make most meals without having a recipe to follow. Iâ€™m not one of those people who can cook from the heart and throw ingredients together with abandon. I need precise measurements (because one personâ€™s pinch of salt might mean something completely different to someone else) and guidelines, otherwise Iâ€™ll short circuit. 2. Do you wanna go dancing at the pink pony club? Sure, why not? Iâ€™m gonna keep on daaaaaan-cingâ€¦ 3. What language would you like to be fluent in: French, Cantonese, Arabic or sign language? All of them. LOL! title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 855
description: Yup, the boss lady wants us to tighten our belts around here. It looks like the economy is slowing down a bit, so no more Tuesday all-you-can-eat turkey or free five-egg omelets in the cafeteria. She wants everyone in the company to cut back, and that includes Rosie and Marnie. Starting immediately, there will be no more kibble showers! The leadership committee is hard at work identifying opportunities for process improvementâ€¦ Rosie and CHO (Chief Hugging Officer) Whiskers are upping the napping quota by a staggering 15%! That means more hugs for everyone! Or else!!! Itâ€™s gonna be rough for a while. Hopefully things turn around soon. I have faith in Rosieâ€™s leadership ability. And where many leaders lack empathy, she really goes out of her way to show she cares about people. Itâ€™s very motivating! Marnie is totally fired up about it. I sure wish Tabs were still around because he was so good at business. He would have known how to navigate a downturn better than anyone. ðŸ˜Š Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict,[Continue reading...] The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 855 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.

Marvelâ€™s five-and-a-half-hour livestream panned across chairs with actorsâ€™ names on their backs to let us know which heroes would be appearing in the next Avengers movie, showing off a new reveal roughly every 12 minutes.Â  Unfortunately, as annoying [â€¦]
author: Austen Goslin

title: Kung fu roguelike Forestrike feels like a Sifu demake in the best possible way
description: Quick reflexes and brute strength will only get you so far in the brawls of Forestrike. This Devolver-published rougelike of pixel art punishment was announced last summer and has been quietly meditating in a bush somewhere ever since. But this week the developers released a demo in which you can practice the flowing dodges and sneaky turnarounds of the "Leaf" school (a style of fighting from one of five masters planned to appear in the full game). As the fighty boy of RPS, I've had a go. It's quite the satisfying little bruiser. Imagine if someone demade Sifu with retro graphics and wisdomously advised you that the brain hits harder than the hand. Read more
author: Brendan Caldwell

title: inZoi early access review
description: I was, like so many of my 1990s-born peers, a huge Sims girlie. I spent hundreds of hours as a teen and young adult making people I knew, characters from shows I was obsessing over, or original characters I wanted to experiment with, and diligently following their life paths and ambitions. I played it as a traditional life sim and I also got into all the weird, scrappy lore. I played with all the cheats and glitches and I, of course, put my sims in the pool and took the ladder out so that they were forced to drown. Try as I might, I could not capture any of these feelings in InZOI, Kraftonâ€™s early access life simulator that I would not typically immediately compare to another game if it did not beg for it by lifting every part of its design from the 25-year-old series that defined the genre. At first, navigating my shiny, photorealistic, model-perfect Zoiâ€™s around the shiny, photorealistic, model-perfect world, I feared that I am simply thirty years old and that the whimsy in my heart has withered with time. But in the end, I must insist that itâ€™s not me who is wrong. InZOI simply has awful vibes. Read more
